page.title: 05HOUND TRAILS FROM THE MOOR
page.content: One of the most popular sports in Cleator Moor is Hound Dog TRAILING. The youngest age for a hound dog to race is 12 months.The pups run about 5 miles and the dogs run about 10 miles.We train the dogs by making them follow a scent which is aniseed and paraffin.Our local trail takes place over the fells it is called Wath Brow Trail.The prize money ranges from Â£11 to Â£300.There can be anything from 10 to 100 hounds in a race. These canine athletes have to have a special diet such as shin beef,steak,eggs,sherry and mince.We take the dogs for 3 walks a day. They run about 2 to 3 times a week. The best season for racing is March to October. BY TONY & PETER. aged 11
